item.title: 1 student dead, 1 critically injured in shooting at Kentucky State University
item.description: Classes and campus activities were canceled for the rest of the week after a shooting that police said left one student dead and another in critical condition. Police said a suspect who is not a KSU student was in custody.

item.title: Millions of borrowers in Biden's SAVE plan would start paying under new settlement
item.description: Legal challenges put SAVE borrowers in limbo for months, a time during which they were not required to make payments on their loans. That would change if the proposed settlement is approved.

item.title: 'Pluribus' star Rhea Seehorn says no thanks to a world dictated by group think
item.description: In the Apple TV series, Seehorn stars as a woman named Carol who suddenly finds herself surrounded by people who are inexplicably happy. The only problem: Carol's not interested in joining them.

item.title: Believe it or not, this book makes taxes fascinating
item.description: The Price of Democracy tells the history of taxation from colonization to the present day. It's essential reading for anyone who cares about preserving democracy.

item.title: Raul Malo, lead singer of The Mavericks, has died at 60
item.description: The son of Cuban immigrants, Malo and his band blended country, rock and roll, folk, jump blues, Latin music and Cajun rhythms into a distinct sound anchored by his unmistakable voice.

item.title: Jazz, joy and one ragged Christmas tree: 60 years of 'A Charlie Brown Christmas'
item.description: On Dec. 9, 1965, "A Charlie Brown Christmas" premiered on television. In 1995, Peanuts creator Charles Schulz spoke with NPR's Bob Edwards on Morning Edition.

item.title: Ukraine's last eastern strongholds hang on as Russia fights to take Donbas
item.description: Russia is pushing to take over all of eastern Ukraine's Donbas region, where one resident tells NPR that she feels her "life depends on how our guys at the front hold on."
